result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Tara L. Teesch. Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in custody. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 19, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 2, 3, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3, 4. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Pleas/sentencing set for December 17, 2015 at 10:30 a.m. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he realized he did not have discovery because prelim was never waived. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that cases are not resolved, Atty Gerbers needs more time to speak with Defendant, requests status conference. State advises that he thought cases were resolved. Defendant advises that he didn't have time to meet with Atty Gerbers. If not resolved by next hearing, earlier case will be put on trial docket.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates he contacted defendants mother regarding his court appearance this morning. Defendants mother advised defendant has another doctor appt. this morning, should have requested a two week continuance when in court last week. State has no objection to continuance.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Gerbers requesting adjournment.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from Atty Gerber requesting adjournment as defendant had doctor appt this moring that was scheduled some time ago. State has no objection to adjournment.  Court reschedules.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff.
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
by Janel Rindal
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua J. Fischer appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
